subject: Investing
title: How Companies Report Earnings
description: One-minute skill: How Companies Report Earnings.

hook.text: Four times a year, public companies open their books. Earnings season moves billions in a single afternoon.

buildup.text: The earnings report shows revenue, profit, and guidance. Analysts compare actuals to their estimates.

discovery.text: Beat expectations and the stock jumps. Miss by a penny and it can drop 10%. The bar is set by analysts, not reality.

twist.text: Companies play the expectations game. They guide low so they can 'beat' easily. It's theater with real money.

climax.text: The conference call after the report often matters more. A CEO's tone can move the stock as much as the numbers.

punchline.text: Earnings day is part math, part performance art.

quiz.question: How often do public companies report earnings?
